subject: Creativity
title: Left Brain vs. Right Brain: The Myth That Won't Die
description: A quick, practical guide to Left Brain vs. Right Brain: The Myth That Won't Die.

hook.text: You've heard it a thousand times: left brain = logic, right brain = creativity. It's wrong.

buildup.text: The myth started from Roger Sperry's 1960s split-brain experiments on epilepsy patients.

discovery.text: Modern brain imaging shows creativity uses both hemispheres ‚Äî it requires logic AND imagination together.

twist.text: A 2013 study of 1,000 brains found zero evidence that people are 'left-brained' or 'right-brained.'

climax.text: Creativity needs the whole brain ‚Äî analytical networks and imaginative networks firing in sync.

punchline.text: You're not left-brained or right-brained. You're whole-brained.
